reviewText: I'll start off by saying that Smugglers V is an enjoyable game. Despite zero polish, the game is a fun one-more turn" experience
recommended: you can get immersed in the setting. However
hoursPlayed: Smugglers V: Invasion is the exact same game
voteText: with a little less variety. The hook of Invasion is you can no longer play as the factions: Coalition
votesTotal: but can now play as the Kilrathi from Wing Commander.\n\nThere are some improvments from Smugglers V to Invasion

reviewText: Very well done. This game series is older than FTL, Space Ranger and the X-series together. To do it right, you shouldn´t compare it to those games anyway (like some other reviewers did). You could better describe it as a 2D version of Pirates, Elite and Wing Commander plus a rudimentary adaption of Masters of Orion. With Smugglers: Invasion the grandseigneur of turn-based space trading returns. Don´t be fooled by the graphics, there is a real gem behind the rough edges. The devs have polished the game perfectly (except the graphics, but I don´t care about that anyway). Best of all: You can talk with the dev and he really cares! I've only scratched the surface ... need to get back playing!

reviewText: I bought both Smugglers 5 and Smugglers 5: Invasion before they launched on Steam. Both games are great. When I was a child I got Smugglers 2 as a gift. When Smugglers 5 came out, I immediately bought it for my own child. This expansion adds a lot of new content and playing an alien race for the first time in the series is great.

reviewText: This is what I wrote about the base game:\n\nI tremendously enjoyed this game! I think it is one of the most underrated games on Steam. The series dates back to 2000 or 2001 and each game in the series has been more and more improved. It´s very polished (dev still making regular updates and listens to community) and has a great depth. I cannot understand some of the reviews here. I think they have been fooled by the easy accessibility and did not play long enough to get to the advanced features. In the base game you can fly everything from a fighter up to battleships. I don´t understand how one review can say they aren´t in the game. Also each profession has some unique skills
date: for example a trader can flee the battle and has special skills to defend and delay combat until reinforcements (which other game simulates reinforcements??) arrive or a pirate has special abilities focused on making sure exactly this doesn´t happen.\n\nIf you are looking for a very addictive 2D version of Elite
hoursPlayed: don´t look no further. However if you prefer 3D or very good graphics
voteText: you have to look somewhere else."\n\nThis expansion adds a lot of new cool features and a new playable alien race. Read the feature list and you know what´s different. What you see is what you get."

reviewText: 10/10, like the base game. This is basically an extended and improved version of the base game (= expansion"). Read the feature list. This are exactly the new features you'll get. On a sidenote: The dev took some of the formerly exclusive features of this expansion and added them for free (!) to the base game. I think such a customer service should be supported."

reviewText: Just finished the toturial. Seems like a fun game with loads of depth.\n\n... and now I have played it for many hours, and I feel that the game lacks depth. The graphics are very simple, the music is repetetive, and the story is simple. I really tried to like this game, but in the end I had to concede that it just is not very good.

reviewText: Invasion does not make everything different (it´s an expansion!!), but what it does make different adds so much more to the game! If you liked Smugglers and you have a remotely interest in the new scenario (cat-like warrior aliens invading humans), pick this game up. The base game had been 30$, so 10$ is a bargain and it´s well worth the money.

reviewText: Like I wrote in my longer log-book review for the base game, the graphics look a bit overly simplistic, but I didn´t had a single crash. I found a small bug or two, but nothing really important. A few spelling mistakes.\n\nI´ve loved playing the Jalkath aliens. They are somewhat like the Kilrathi from the Wing Commander universe, but still different enough. I think Invasion is a worthwhile addition and I hope the devs continue the series.

reviewText: Reminds me of 2005 games. The throwback was really great. I mean, in it's current price I don't think I suggest getting this game, it's a bit not worth it but if you have a coupon (which I did) go try this out. Pretty cool game but, well. Just don't get without a coupon.
